question.q:
From a Testing perspective, what are the MAIN purposes of Configuration Management?
i) Identifying the version of software under test. ii) Controlling the version of testware items. iii) Developing new testware items. iv) Tracking changes to testware items. v) Analysing the need for new testware items.
Which of the following is a MAJOR task of test planning?
question.option1: Scheduling test analysis and design tasks.

question.q: Which of the following BEST describes the difference between an inspection and a walkthrough?
question.option1: Both inspections and walkthroughs are led by the author.
question.option2: An inspection is led by a moderator and a walkthrough is led by the author.
question.option3: Both inspections and walkthroughs are led by a trained moderator.
question.option4: A walkthrough is led by the author. The author is not present during inspections.

question.q: Where may functional testing be performed ?
question.option1: A. At system and acceptance testing levels only.
question.option3: C. At all levels above integration testing.
question.option4: D. At the acceptance testing level only.

question.q: What is the MAIN objective when reviewing a software deliverable ?
question.option1: A. To identify potential application failures by use of a test specification.
question.option2: B. To identify defects in any software work product.
question.option3: C. To identify spelling mistakes in a requirements specification.
question.option4: D. To identify standards inconsistencies in the code

question.q: Who would USUALLY perform debugging activities ?
Which of the following would you NOT usually find on a software incident report ?
question.option1: A. The name and/or organisational position of the person raising the problem.
question.option2: B. Version of the Software Under Test.
question.option3: C. Suggestions as to how to fix the problem.

question.q: Which of the following defines the expected results of a test ?

Some tools are geared more for developer use. For the 5 tools listed, which statement BEST details those for developers ? i) Performance testing tools. ii) Coverage measurement tools. ii) Test comparators. iv) Dynamic analysis tools. v) Incident management tools.
question.option1: A. i, iii. and iv. are more for developers.
question.option2: B. ii. and iv. are more for developers.
question.option3: C. ii, iii. and iv. are more for developers.
question.option4: D. ii. and iii. are more for developers.

question.q: Which of the following is correct?
question.option1: A. Impact analysis assesses the effect on the system of a defect found in regression testing.
question.option2: B. Impact analysis assesses the effect of a new person joining the regression test team.
question.option3: C. Impact analysis assesses whether or not a defect found in regression testing has been fixed correctly.
question.option4: D. Impact analysis assesses the effect of a change to the system to determine how much regression testing to do.

question.q: The ___________ Testing will be performed by the people at client own locations
Which of the following is the standard for the Software product quality ?
Which is not a black box testing technique
Find the mismatch
question.option1: A. Test data preparation tools – Manipulate Data bases.
question.option2: B. Test design tools – Generate test inputs.
question.option3: C. Requirement management tools – Enables individual tests to be traceable.
question.option4: D. Configuration management tools – Check for consistence.

question.q: Use cases can be performed to test
Purpose of test design technique is
question.option1: A. Identifying test conditions only, not Identifying test cases.
question.option2: B. Not Identifying test conditions, Identifying test cases only.
question.option3: C. Identifying test conditions and Identifying test cases.
question.option4: D. Identifying test conditions or Identifying test cases.

question.q: One person has been dominating the current software process improvement meeting. Which of the following techniques should the facilitator use to bring other team members into the discussion?
question.option1: A. Confront the person and ask that other team members be allowed to express their opinions.
question.option2: B. Wait for the person to pause, acknowledge the person’ s opinion, and ask for someone else’ s opinion.
question.option3: C. Switch the topic to an issue about which the person does not have a strong opinion.
question.option4: D. Express an opinion that differs from the person’ s opinion in order to encourage others to express their ideas.

question.q: Stochastic testing using statistical information or operational profiles uses the following method
question.option4: D. Process or standard compliant testing approach.

question.q: A software model that can’t be used in functional testing
Arc testing is known as
As part of which test process do you determine the exit criteria ?
question.option2: B. Evaluating exit criteria and reporting.

question.q: Which of the following is a MAJOR task of test implementation and execution ?
question.option3: C. Identifying test conditions or test requirements.
question.option4: D. Assessing if more tests are needed.

question.q: What is beta testing?
question.option1: A. Testing performed by potential customers at the developers location.
question.option2: B. Testing performed by potential customers at their own locations.
question.option3: C. Testing performed by product developers at the customer's location.
question.option4: D. Testing performed by product developers at their own locations.

question.q: Given the following fragment of code, how many tests are required for 100% decision coverage? if width > length then biggest_dimension = width if height > width then biggest_dimension = height end_if else biggest_dimension = length if height > length then biggest_dimension = height end_if end_if

You have designed test cases to provide 100% statement and 100% decision coverage for the following fragment of code. if width > length then biggest_dimension = width else biggest_dimension = length end_if
The following has been added to the bottom of the code fragment above.
print "Biggest dimension is " & biggest_dimension print "Width: " & width print "Length: " & length
How many more test cases are required?
question.option1: A. One more test case will be required for 100 % decision coverage.
question.option2: B. Two more test cases will be required for 100 % statement coverage, one of which will be used to provide 100% decision coverage.
question.option3: C. None, existing test cases can be used.
question.option4: D. One more test case will be required for 100" statement coverage.

question.q: A thermometer measures temperature in whole degrees only. If the temperature falls below 18 degrees, the heating is switched off. It is switched on again when the temperature reaches 21 degrees. What are the best values in degrees to cover all equivalence partitions?
Which activity in the fundamental test process creates test suites for efficient test execution ?
Which of the following is TRUE ?
question.option1: A. Confirmation testing is testing fixes to a set of defects and Regression testing is testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes.
question.option2: B. Confirmation testing is testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes and Regression testing is testing fixes to a set of defects.
question.option3: C. Confirmation testing and Regression testing are both testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes.
question.option4: . Confirmation testing and Regression testing are both testing fixes to a set of defects.

question.q:
Which of the following are characteristic of regression testing ?
i) Regression testing is run ONLY once ii) Regression testing is used after fixes have been made iii) Regression testing is often automated iv) Regression tests need not be maintained
When should configuration management procedures be implemented?
The ___________ technique can be used to achieve input and output coverage
The __________ testing is performed at the developing organization’s site
What is the main purpose of Informal review
question.option1: A. Inexpensive way to get some benefit.
question.option3: C. Learning, gaining understanding, effect finding.
question.option4: D. Discuss, make decisions, solve technical problems

question.q: _______ includes both Black box and White Box Testing features
Which is not a Component testing
The software engineer's role in tool selection is
question.option1: A. To identify, evaluate, and rank tools, and recommend tools to management.
question.option2: B. To determine what kind of tool is needed, then find it and buy it.
question.option3: C. To initiate the tool search and present a case to management.
question.option4: D. To identify, evaluate and select the tools

question.q: Which is not the fundamental test process
The purpose of exit criteria is ?
question.option1: A. Define when to stop testing.
question.option3: C. When a set of tests has achieved a specific pre condition.

question.q: The ________ and ________ are used within individual workbenches to produce the right output products.
Which is not the software characteristics

Verification involves which of the following :- i. Helps to check the Quality of the built product ii. Helps to check that we have built the right product. iii. Helps in developing the product iv. Monitoring tool wastage and obsoleteness.
question.option2: B. i is true and ii,iii,iv are false
question.option3: C. i,ii,iii are true and iv is false
question.option4: D. ii is true and i,iii,iv are false

question.q: A wholesaler sells printer cartridges. The minimum order quantity is 5. There is a 20% discount for orders of 100 or more printer cartridges. You have been asked to prepare test cases using various values for the number of printer cartridges ordered. Which of the following groups contain three test inputs that would be generated using Boundary Value Analysis?

Which of the following activities should be performed during the selection and implementation of a testing tool?
i) Investigate the organisation's test process. ii) Conduct a proof of concept. iii) Implement the selected tool on a project behind schedule to save time. iv) Identify coaching and mentoring requirements for the use of the selected tool.
What is the MAIN benefit of designing tests early in the life cycle?
question.option1: A. It is cheaper than designing tests during the test phases.
question.option2: B. It helps prevent defects from being introduced into the code.
question.option3: C. Tests designed early are more effective than tests designed later.
question.option4: D. It saves time during the testing phases when testers are busy.

question.q:
Which of the following benefits are MOST likely to be achieved by using test tools?
i) Easy to access information about tests and testing. ii) Reduced maintenance of testware. iii) Easy and cheap to implement. iv) Greater consistency of tests.
What is the KEY difference between preventative and reactive approaches to testing?
question.option1: A. Preventative tests and reactive tests are designed as early as possible.
question.option2: B. Preventative tests are designed early; reactive tests are designed after the software has been produced.
question.option3: C. Preventative testing is always analytical; reactive testing is always heuristic.
question.option4: D. Preventative tests are designed after the software has been produced; reactive tests are designed early in response to review comments.

question.q: What is the purpose of exit criteria?
question.option1: A. To define when a test level is complete.
question.option2: B. To determine when a test has completed.
question.option3: C. To identify when a software system should be retired.
question.option4: D. To determine whether a test has passed.

question.q: What determines the level of risk?
question.option1: A. The cost of dealing with an adverse event if it occurs.
question.option2: B. The probability that an adverse event will occur.
question.option3: C. The amount of testing planned before release of a system.
question.option4: D. The likelihood of an adverse event and the impact of the event.

question.q: With which of the following categories is a test comparator tool USUALLY associated?
question.option1: A. Tool support for performance and monitoring.
question.option2: B. Tool support for static testing.
question.option3: C. Tool support for test execution and logging.
question.option4: D. Tool support for the management of testing and tests.

question.q:
Which activities form part of test planning?
i) Developing test cases. ii) Defining the overall approach to testing. iii) Assigning resources. iv) Building the test environment v) Writing test conditions.
question.option1: A. i, ii & iv are true, iii & v are false.
question.option2: B. ii & iii are true, i, iv & v are false.
question.option3: C. iv & v are true, i, ii & iii are false.
question.option4: D. i, ii & iii are true iv & v are false.

question.q:
Match the following terms and statements.
1.Decision Table Testing 2.Decision Testing 3.State Transition Testing 4.Exploratory Testing
W. Testing carried out w boxes to achieve specific test objectives, possibly to complement structured testing. X. A test technique used which may be used to verify different system re depending on current conditions or previous history. Y. A test technique which combines combinations of inputs that might not otherwise have been exercised during testing. Z. A form of control flow testing based on decision outcomes.
The principle of Cyclomatic complexity, considering L as edges or links, N as nodes, P as independent paths
FPA is used to
question.option1: A. To measure the functional requirements of the project.
question.option2: B. To measure the size of the functionality of an Information system.
question.option3: C. To measure the functional testing effort.
question.option4: D. To measure the functional flow.

question.q: A _____ is the step-by-step method followed to ensure that standards are met
Which is not a test Oracle
question.option1: A. The existing system (For a bench mark)

question.q: PDCA is known as
Which is the non-functional testing
A Test Plan Outline contains which of the following: i. Test Items ii. Test Scripts iii. Test Deliverables iv. Responsibilities
question.option1: A. i,ii,iii are true and iv is false.
question.option2: B. i,iii,iv are true and ii is false.
question.option3: C. ii,iii are true and i and iv are false.
question.option4: D. i,ii are false and iii , iv are true.

question.q: Testing where in we subject the target of the test , to varying workloads to measure and evaluate the performance behaviors and ability of the target and of the test to continue to function properly under these different workloads.

Which of the following is the task of a Tester? i. Interaction with the Test Tool Vendor to identify best ways to leverage test tool on the project. ii. Prepare and acquire Test Data iii. Implement Tests on all test levels, execute and log the tests. iv. Create the Test Specifications
question.option1: A. i, ii, iii is true and iv is false.
question.option2: B. ii,iii,iv is true and i is false.
question.option3: C. i is true and ii,iii,iv are false.
question.option4: D. iii and iv is correct and i and ii are incorrect.

question.q: Which type of test design techniques does the following statement best describe a procedure to derive test cases based on the specification of a component ?
For which of the following would a static analysis tool be MOST useful ?
question.option2: B. Validating models of the software.
question.option3: C. Testing code executed in a special test harness.

question.q:
Which of the following types of defects is use case testing MOST LIKELY to uncover?
i) Defects in the process flows during real-world use of the system. ii) Defects in the interface parameters in integration testing. iii) Integration defects caused by the interaction and interference of different components. iv) Defects in the system as it transitions between one state and another.
Which of the following is MOST important in the selection of a test approach?
question.option1: A. Availability of tools to support the proposed techniques.
question.option2: B. The budget allowed for training in proposed techniques.
question.option3: C. Available skills and experience in the proposed techniques.
question.option4: D. The willingness of the test team to learn new techniques.

question.q: Which of the following is a benefit of test independence ?
question.option1: A. It does not require familiarity with the code.
question.option2: B. It is cheaper than using developers to test their own code.
question.option3: C. It avoids author bias in defining effective tests.
question.option4: D. Testers are better at finding defects than developers.

question.q: Which of the following is MOST characteristic of specification based (black-box) techniques?
question.option1: A. Test cases can be easily automated.
question.option2: B. Test cases are independent of each other.
question.option3: C. Test cases are derived systematically from models of the system .
question.option4: D. Test cases are derived systematically from the delivered code.

question.q: Which of the following combinations correctly describes a valid approach to component testing: i) Functional testing of the component in isolation. ii) Structure-based testing of the code without recording incidents. iii) Automated tests that are run until the component passes. iv) Functional testing of the interfaces between modules.
Which of the following is a purpose of the review planning phase?
question.option2: B. Explain the documents to the participants.

question.q: A defect arrival rate curve:
question.option1: A. Shows the number of newly discovered defects per unit time
question.option2: B. Shows the number of open defects per unit time.
question.option3: C. Shows the cumulative total number of defects found up to this time.
question.option4: D. Any of these, depending on the company.

question.q: Which is the best definition of complete testing:
question.option1: A. You have discovered every bug in the program.
question.option2: B. You have tested every statement, branch, and combination of branches in the program.
question.option3: C. You have completed every test in the test plan.
question.option4: D. You have reached the scheduled ship date.

question.q: What can static analysis NOT find
question.option1: A. The use of a variable before it has been defined.

question.q: White Box Techniques are also called as:
Reviewing the test Basis is a part of which phase
question.option4: D. Evaluating exit criteria and reporting.

question.q: Component Testing is also called as :- i. Unit Testing ii. Program Testing iii. Module Testing iv. System Component Testing .
question.option1: A. i,ii,iii are true and iv is false.
question.option3: C. i,ii,iv are true and iii is false.
question.option4: D. all of above is true.

question.q: Which of the following is not a major task of Exit criteria?
question.option1: A. Checking test logs against the exit criteria specified in test planning.
question.option2: B. Logging the outcome of test execution.
question.option3: C. Assessing if more tests are needed.
question.option4: D. Writing a test summary report for stakeholders.

question.q: Which of the following is true about Formal Review or Inspection:- i. Led by Trained Moderator (not the author). ii. No Pre Meeting Preparations iii. Formal Follow up process. iv. Main Objective is to find defects
question.option1: A. ii is true and i,iii,iv are false.
question.option2: B. i,iii,iv are true and ii is false.
question.option3: C. i,iii,iv are false and ii is true.
question.option4: D. iii is true and I,ii,iv are false.

question.q: The Phases of formal review process is mentioned below arrange them in the correct order. i. Planning ii. Review Meeting iii. Rework iv. Individual Preparations v. Kick Off vi. Follow Up
Testing activity which is performed to expose defects in the interfaces and in the interaction between integrated components is :
Methodologies adopted while performing Maintenance Testing:-
question.option1: A. Breadth Test and Depth Test.

question.q: The Switch is switched off once the temperature falls below 18 and then it is turned on when the temperature is more than 21. When the temperature is more than 21. Identify the Equivalance values which belong to the same class.
Complete statement and branch coverage means:
question.option1: A. That you have tested every statement in the program.
question.option2: B. That you have tested every statement and every branch in the program.
question.option3: C. That you have tested every IF statement in the program.
question.option4: D. That you have tested every combination of values of IF statements in the program

question.q: There are several risks of managing your project's schedule with a statistical reliability model. These include (choose one or more of the following):
question.option1: A. Testers spend more energy early in the product trying to find bugs than preparing to do the rest of the project's work more efficiently
question.option2: B. Managers might not realize that the testing effort is ineffective, late in the project, because they expect a low rate of bug finding, so the low rate achieved doesn't alarm them.
question.option3: C. It can increase the end-of-project pressure on testers to not find bugs, or to not report bugs.

question.q: Reviews, static analysis and dynamic testing have the same objective
We can achieve complete statement coverage but still miss bugs because:
question.option1: A. The failure occurs only if you reach a statement taking the TRUE branch of an IF statement, and you got to the statement with a test that passed through the FALSE branch.
question.option2: B. The failure depends on the program's inability to handle specific data values, rather than on the program's flow of control.
question.option3: C. We are not required to test code that customers are unlikely to execute.

question.q: Measurement dysfunction is a problem because:
question.option1: A. Even though the numbers you look at appear better, to achieve these numbers, people are doing other aspects of their work much less well.
question.option2: B. We don't know how to measure a variable (our measurement is dysfunctional) and so we don't know how to interpret the result.
question.option3: C. You are measuring the wrong thing and thus reaching the wrong conclusions.

question.q: Important consequences of the impossibility of complete testing are (Choose one or more answers):
question.option1: A. We can never be certain that the program is bug free.
question.option2: B. We have no definite stopping point for testing, which makes it easier for some managers to argue for very little testing.
question.option3: C. We have no easy answer for what testing tasks should always be required, because every task takes time that could be spent on other high importance tasks.

question.q: Poor software characteristics are
question.option3: C. Project risks and Product risks
question.option4: D. Project risks or Product risks

question.q: System testing should investigate
question.option1: A. Non-functional requirements only not Functional requirements
question.option2: B. Functional requirements only not non-functional requirements
question.option3: C. Non-functional requirements and Functional requirements
question.option4: D. Non-functional requirements or Functional requirements

question.q: Contract and regulation testing is a part of
Find the correct flow of the phases of a formal review
question.option1: A. Planning, Review meeting, Rework, Kick off
question.option2: B. Planning, Individual preparation, Kick off, Rework
question.option3: C. Planning, Review meeting, Rework, Follow up
question.option4: D. Planning, Individual preparation, Follow up, Kick off

question.q: What is an equivalence partition (also known as an equivalence class)?
question.option1: A. A set of test cases for testing classes of objects
question.option2: B. An input or output range of values such that only one value in the range becomes a test case
question.option3: C. An input or output range of values such that each value in the range becomes a test case
question.option4: D. An input or output range of values such that every tenth value in the range becomes a test case

question.q: In a Examination a candidate has to score minimum of 24 marks inorder to clear the exam. The maximum that he can score is 40 marks. Identify the Valid Equivalance values if the student clears the exam.
One of the fields on a form contains a text box which accepts alpha numeric values. Identify the Valid Equivalence class
A Person who documents all the issues, problems and open points that were identified during a formal review
A Type of functional Testing, which investigates the functions relating to detection of threats, such as virus from malicious outsiders.
Designing the test environment set-up and identifying any required infrastructure and tools are a part of which phase
question.option3: C. Evaluating the Exit Criteria and reporting

question.q: Which of the following statements regarding static testing is false:
question.option1: A. Static testing requires the running of tests through the code
question.option2: B. Static testing includes desk checking
question.option3: C. Static testing includes techniques such as reviews and inspections
question.option4: D. Static testing can give measurements such as cyclomatic complexity

question.q: Who are the persons involved in a Formal Review :- i. Manager ii. Moderator iii. Scribe / Recorder iv. Assistant Manager
question.option2: B. i,ii,iii are true and iv is false.
question.option3: C. ii,iii,iv are true and i is false.
question.option4: D. i,iv are true and ii, iii are false.

question.q: Link Testing is also called as :
Which of the following is not a part of the Test Implementation and Execution Phase
question.option1: A. Creating test suites from the test cases
question.option2: B. Executing test cases either manually or by using test execution tools
